item.title: Socioeconomic Outlooks between Anglo and Franco-Canadians
item.description: Part I. Introduction The divide between English and French Canadians has historically been the source of much social tension in this country. Franco-Canadians have historically found themselves in opposition to and oppressed by the English majority. This disparity can bee seen in historical records. The goal of this analysis is to find any gaps between these two groups that can be seen in contemporary Canadian society, as a result of these tensions.
